intro: Caruelina anisomeris, commonly known as the variable caruelia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. Its leaves are alternate and often have a rough or hairy texture. Caruelina anisomeris is known for its variability in leaf shape and flowering patterns, which has led to the recognition of several subspecies.
